item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description:
Experience

PMO — Eviden, Madrid (2023–2025)

  • Power BI modelling and data analysis.
  • General project assistance and coordination.

Agent Credit Control — Small World FS, Madrid (2022–2023)

  • Managed credit operations for external collaborators and led negotiation plus KPI tracking.
  • Designed, prototyped, and deployed semi-automated VBA/Excel solutions, including staff training.
  • Drove UX and workflow improvements.

Global Coordination — FOSC, Madrid (2018–2021)

  • Coordinated a multi-project environment and handled effort estimation, resource allocation, and conflict resolution.
  • Led activity planning, definition, and operational support while engaging stakeholders.

Music Teacher — French Government, Mayotte (2017–2018)

  • Managed classes, prepared and delivered course content, and evaluated students.

Cellular Modelling — FIAS, Frankfurt (2016–2017)

  • Modelled migration of T. brucei and validated data with biology lab partners.
  • Conducted bibliographic research.

PhD Student (unfinished) — Würzburg / Frankfurt (2016–2017)

  • Researched modelling and simulation of cell migration in F. Matthäus’ group over an 8-month period.

EEG Data Analysis — Laboratoire Dynamique du Langage, Lyon (2015)

  • Studied interactions between tactile stimuli and language processing using ERPLab in MATLAB.

Quality Testing Intern — The CoSMo Company, Lyon (2014)

  • Automated code analysis tooling, evaluated state-of-the-art analysers, and built Qt/C++ test bricks.

Neural Modelling Intern — ZI Mannheim, Germany (2013)

  • Ported a prefrontal cortex model from C++ to the Python-based NEST environment while learning computational neural modelling and multithreading.

Manual Worker — Airbus (2009)

  • Assisted with assembly of A319/A320 aircraft pylons and gained hands-on workshop experience.

item.title: Education
item.description:
Technical Education

Engineering Degree in Bioinformatics and Modelling — INSA de Lyon (2008–2014)

Master-equivalent five-year program spanning biology, computer science, mathematics, modelling, and applied research.

Detailed Technical Training from the Bioinformatics & Modelling Cycle (BIM)

  • Mathematics: linear algebra, PDEs, dynamical systems, game theory, genomics mathematics, introductory AI.
  • Biology: cell biology, biochemistry, genetics, crystallography, proteomics, phylogenetics, drug design, experiment design, MRI, COPASI network modelling.
  • Computer Science: C, C++, Python, R, MATLAB, MySQL, KNIME, computational biology, agent-based models, pharmacological & epidemiological models, UI design, servers & networking, FIJI image/sound processing.
  • Statistics: ANOVA, PCA, Bayesian statistics, Monte-Carlo methods, linear & non-linear regression.

Additional University Modules

  • Coding & cryptography (pre-cycle focus).
  • Core engineering fundamentals (mathematics, physics, mechanics, chemistry).
  • International EURINSA program participation.

Artistic Education

  • Content forthcoming.

Other Education

  • Content forthcoming.

item.title: My Sky
item.description:
Western Astrology Snapshot

  • Sun in Taurus — keeps my research grounded; I anchor projects with patient iteration.
  • Moon in Aquarius — fuels curiosity for collective wellbeing and experimental study designs.
  • Rising Sagittarius — the optimistic teacher energy that shows up when presenting fieldwork stories.
  • Current transit focus: balancing Saturn’s structure with Venus-led creativity in collaborative teams.

Chinese Earthly Branches & Elements

  • Born in the Wood Ox year, so long-game strategies and persistence feel natural.
  • Monthly pillar sits in Metal Snake, reminding me to refine details and honor intuition.
  • I keep a small spreadsheet tracking how each branch/element shows up in mood, energy, and relationship dynamics.

Rituals Under the Sky

  • New Moon sketches combine ergonomic diagrams with constellation lines.
  • Full Moon playlists guide restorative stretching sessions for colleagues after audits.

item.title: Other Interests & Skills
item.description:
Languages

  • Spanish (native)
  • French — TCF C1
  • English — TOEIC 950 (2013)
  • German — B1
  • Chinese (basic)

Licenses & Certifications

  • Car and motorbike driving license
  • Boat license
  • Open Water Diver (PADI)

Associations & Hobbies

  • MENSA member
  • Member, musician, and organiser in various student associations
  • Participation in waterpolo (INSA)
  • Long-term engagement in cultural and international student groups
  • Blog writing

item.title: Personal Development
item.description:
Self-Growth & Integrative Practices

  • Family Constellations training (Svagito Liebermeister, 2021): experiential approach to systemic healing.
  • Enneagram practice: ongoing work with personality archetypes for self-observation.
  • Taichi & Qigong training (INEF Madrid, 2022): cultivating balance, breath, and body awareness.
  • Interpersonal communication: strong facilitation and conflict-resolution skills across teams.
  • Multidisciplinary bridge-building: translate ideas between science, art, and technology circles.
  • Ethics, spirituality, and emotional awareness: continuous study of mind–body practices.
  • Teaching & choreography background: experience guiding groups and crafting human dynamics.

item.title: The Artist
item.description:
Theatre

  • Don Claudio in ¡Sublime decisión! — Nómadas Theatre Group, INSA Lyon (2008–2009).
  • Narrator in a French adaptation of 1984 for the INSA Ethics Department (2013).

Music

  • Clarinet player in multiple FOSC youth orchestras (from age 12 to present).
  • Clarinetist in Band’AS, the INSA university street band (2010–2014).
  • Music teacher at Middle School Kwalé, Mayotte (2017–2018).

Dance

  • Dancer, teacher, and choreographer in the INSA Club Rock (French rock’n’roll partner dance).
  • Performed and developed choreography with the association (2010–2014).
  • Served as Club Rock vice-president (2012–2013).

Video

  • Designed and launched a student advertising campaign for Club Rock.
  • Created the YouTube miniseries El Despertador.

Artistic Links

  • Singing in the Park
  • Club Rock — Advertising Campaign
  • Dancing 1
  • Dancing 2
  • Dancing 3
  • Choreography
  • Both (dance duo)
  • Miniseries “El Despertador”
  • Clarinet in Prague
  • Blog
